item.title: Text Messaging To The Stars
item.description:
Instead of texting Hollywood stars, how about sending a message to another planet? You can join a project called “Hello From Earth,” which sent text messages to Gliese 581d, a planet outside our solar system. Located 20 light years away in the constellation Libra, it will take about 20 years for your message to reach these potential extraterrestrials. While we don’t know who or what might receive our messages, many people chose to send greetings of peace...

item.title: The Internet Launches Into Space
item.description:
The internet has conquered Earth and is now reaching for the stars. While “Google ET” might be a bit premature, efforts are underway to extend the internet’s reach into space. The initial steps involve using internet technology within Earth’s orbit. Eventually, we might be assigning planet and galaxy codes to complement our current country codes. But first, let’s explore these initial steps. Cisco is pioneering the use of routers in orbit through a defense department program called IRIS (Internet Routing In Space)...
